intro: Castilleja sphaerostigma, commonly known as the globe Indian paintbrush, is a hemiparasitic flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its vivid red, tubular flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has slender, branching stems and small, scale-like leaves, which are adapted for parasitic growth on the roots of other plants. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it a notable species in its native habitat. Castilleja sphaerostigma plays an important part in supporting pollinators and maintaining biodiversity in its ecosystem.
